page.title: 04BOURNE WOODS
page.content: The{landscape}of Bourne includes a big wood on its west side. It stretches from Bourne to Morton. It has three smaller{woods}joined onto it, Pillar Wood, Auster Wood and Fox Wood. The woods used to belong to Lady Jane Willoughby until three years ago when her father, Lord Ancaster died and she had to pay off the death duty. The woods used to be part of the great forest which once covered much of the East Midlands. Although the woods now belong to the{Forestry Commission}the public are allowed to enjoy walks provided in it and to watch wildlife. The main types of{trees}are Douglas fir, oak, ash, beech, silver birch and larch. There is a lot of{wildlife}in the woods including grey squirrel, deer, birds of prey and woodpeckers.
